THE HISTORY OF AIKIDO

Aikido is an exciting and dynamic martial arts for kids of all ages. It is a non-violent and non-aggressive martial art and a great way for children to have fun and stay healthy. We have Aikido martial art classes for kids on weekday evenings and Saturday mornings (click here for class schedule). Boys and girls ages 5 through 12 are welcome to join the children's Aikido classes.

The kids martial arts classes typically start with stretching and warm-up exercises. Children learn how to roll and perform Aikido techniques, including self-defense moves. Games are also played to help children develop their balance and coordination. Belt tests are conducted on a regular basis.

The supreme challenge of the warrior is to turn an enemy's wrath into harmless laughter.

-Ueshiba Morihei  founder of Aikido

benefits of Aikido

With Aikido martial arts, children learn self-discipline and

improve their concentration and self-respect

Aikido also builds awarness, self-confidence, teamwork, and

a sense of social and community responsibility.
